page.title: 13Kingsmead Mill
page.content: It is 3KM south east of {Malmesbury.} In the early 19th century it was 3 cottages and a mill but was later changed to 1 house and mill.It is made of Cotswold stone and the stables are 135 years old.The mill workers lived in the cottages.The mill was used for grinding corn then in 1953 for grinding animal food.It was milling until 1962.In 1982 it was bought by film producer David Puttnam who made "Chariots of fire"and "The Killing Fields".He has converted the stables to two flats,an office and a Movieola which is a room for editing films.Some times scriptwriters stay in the flats while writing film scripts.A public foot path passes west of the house beside the weir.The mill produces it's own electricity.The river drives a turbine.Surplus electricity is fed into the national grid.
